title: NBA Daily News Digest
subtitle: February 26, 2026 â€“ Your daily dose of hoops action!

items.headline: Lakers Eye Cavaliers' Jarrett Allen in Blockbuster Trade Rumor
items.summary: The Los Angeles Lakers are reportedly exploring a trade for Cleveland Cavaliers center Jarrett Allen, with Austin Reaves and future draft picks potentially heading to Cleveland. This move aims to bolster a Lakers roster built around Luka Doncic and LeBron James.

items.headline: All-Star Deni Avdija Continues to Battle Back Injury
items.summary: Portland Trail Blazers All-Star forward Deni Avdija remains sidelined with a recurring lower back injury. After exiting the Blazers-Suns game on February 22 early, Avdija was inactive for the February 24 and February 25 games and is officially out for Thursday's game against Chicago. Avdija, the first Israeli native selected to the NBA All-Star Team, has been averaging 24.4 points, 7.0 rebounds, and 6.6 assists this season.

items.headline: Jokic Dominates as Nuggets Down Celtics
items.summary: Nikola Jokic led the Denver Nuggets to a commanding victory over the Boston Celtics. Jamal Murray left the game early due to illness.

items.headline: Spurs Rally to Extend Winning Streak to Ten
items.summary: The San Antonio Spurs staged a fourth-quarter comeback to defeat the Toronto Raptors, securing their tenth consecutive win.

items.headline: Pistons Handle Short-Handed Thunder
items.summary: The Detroit Pistons defeated the Oklahoma City Thunder, who were missing several key players including Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and Chet Holmgren.

items.headline: Jokic's Double-Double Performance
items.statContext: Led DEN to victory over BOS.

items.headline: Jaylin Williams Nets Career-High
items.statContext: Achieved a career-high for OKC against DET.

items.headline: Spurs Duo Powers Comeback
items.statContext: Key contributors in SAS's rally against TOR.

items.headline: Raptors' Scoring Leaders
items.statContext: Top performers for TOR in tough loss to SAS.

items.headline: Wembanyama's Defensive Presence
items.statContext: Showcased defensive prowess despite a quieter scoring night for SAS.

items.headline: 2026 NBA Trade Deadline Sets New Records
items.summary: The recent NBA trade deadline on February 6, 2026, saw a flurry of activity with a record 28 deals completed and 73 players changing teams. Notable moves included James Harden to CLE, Jaren Jackson Jr. to UTA, and Anthony Davis to WAS.

items.headline: Key Injuries Affecting NBA Landscape
items.summary: Injuries continue to impact teams across the league. Jayson Tatum (BOS) is out with an Achilles injury, Tyrese Haliburton (IND) is out with an ACL tear, and Devin Booker (PHX) is sidelined with a hip injury. Several OKC stars, including Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and Chet Holmgren, missed their last game.

items.headline: Eastern Conference Playoff Picture Heats Up
items.summary: As of February 25, the Detroit Pistons lead the Eastern Conference with a 42-14 record, followed by the Boston Celtics (38-19) and the New York Knicks (37-22). The Cleveland Cavaliers are tied with the Knicks, and the Toronto Raptors round out the top five.

items.headline: Western Conference Race Tight at the Top
items.summary: In the Western Conference, the Oklahoma City Thunder hold the top spot with a 45-14 record, trailed by the San Antonio Spurs (41-16) and the Houston Rockets (35-21). The Denver Nuggets (36-22), Minnesota Timberwolves (36-23), and Los Angeles Lakers (34-23) are also strong contenders in a competitive conference.

items.headline: Lakers vs. Suns
items.summary: Luka Doncic and Mark Williams are players to watch as the Lakers visit the Suns in Phoenix.

items.headline: Hornets vs. Pacers
items.summary: Charlotte travels to Indiana for an Eastern Conference matchup.

items.headline: Heat vs. 76ers
items.summary: Miami heads to Philadelphia for a battle in the East.

items.headline: Rockets vs. Magic
items.summary: The Houston Rockets take on the Orlando Magic.

items.headline: Pelicans vs. Jazz
items.summary: The New Orleans Pelicans visit the Utah Jazz at the Delta Center.
